channel.title: Comments on: Overheard at a shul kiddush
channel.description: notes on Jewish theology and spirituality

item.title: By: Alan Brill
item.dc:creator: Alan Brill
item.description:
In reply to <a href="https://kavvanah.wordpress.com/2010/06/08/overheard-at-a-shul-kiddush/#comment-1152">Avraham Bronstein</a>.
It was actually a seudah after a brit on Sunday. It was not a regular at that synagogue.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Avraham Bronstein.

It was actually a seudah after a brit on Sunday. It was not a regular at that synagogue.

item.title: By: Avraham Bronstein
item.dc:creator: Avraham Bronstein
item.description: Was this a shul kiddush in the last two weeks?
item.content:encoded: Was this a shul kiddush in the last two weeks?

item.title: By: AS
item.dc:creator: AS
item.description: The number of closet molech worshipers is clearly increasing.
item.content:encoded: The number of closet molech worshipers is clearly increasing.

item.title: By: Reb Yudel
item.dc:creator: Reb Yudel
item.description: A logical enough response to a deity who requires worship and ritual but, unlike the evangelical god, never talks back.
item.content:encoded: A logical enough response to a deity who requires worship and ritual but, unlike the evangelical god, never talks back.
